# Serde repr derive
[![github](https://img.shields.io/badge/github-dtolnay/serde--repr-8da0cb?style=for-the-badge&labelColor=555555&logo=github)](https://github.com/dtolnay/serde-repr) [![crates.io](https://img.shields.io/crates/v/serde_repr.svg?style=for-the-badge&color=fc8d62&logo=rust)](https://crates.io/crates/serde_repr) [![docs.rs](https://img.shields.io/badge/docs.rs-serde__repr-66c2a5?style=for-the-badge&labelColor=555555&logo=docs.rs)](https://docs.rs/serde_repr) [![build status](https://img.shields.io/github/actions/workflow/status/dtolnay/serde-repr/ci.yml?branch=master&style=for-the-badge)](https://github.com/dtolnay/serde-repr/actions?query=branch%3Amaster)
This crate provides a derive macro to derive Serde's ``Serialize`` and ``Deserialize`` traits in a way that delegates to the underlying repr of a C-like enum.
```
```[``dependencies``]`
`serde ``=` ``"`1.0`"``
`serde_repr ``=` ``"`0.1`"``
``
```
```
``use` `serde_repr`::````{`Serialize_repr`,` Deserialize_repr```}```;`
``#``[``derive```(```Serialize_repr`,` Deserialize_repr`,` PartialEq`,` Debug```)```]``
``#``[``repr```(```u8```)```]``
``enum` `SmallPrime` ``{`
  Two `=` `2``,`
  Three `=` `3``,`
  Five `=` `5``,`
  Seven `=` `7``,`
```}```
``fn` `main`````(````)```` ``->` `serde_json`::````Result``<``(``)``>``` ````{`
  `let` j `=` `serde_json`::``to_string`(``&``SmallPrime`::``Seven`)``?``;`
  `assert_eq!``(`j`,` ``"`7`"```)``;`
  `let` p`:` SmallPrime `=` `serde_json`::``from_str`(```"`2`"```)``?``;`
  `assert_eq!``(`p`,` `SmallPrime`::``Two`)``;`
  `Ok``(``(``)``)`
```}```
`
```

#### License
Licensed under either of [Apache License, Version 2.0](https://github.com/dtolnay/serde-repr/blob/dddfad6f5a6e6ba904461a5dc3f12a458ddb0f81/LICENSE-APACHE) or [MIT license](https://github.com/dtolnay/serde-repr/blob/dddfad6f5a6e6ba904461a5dc3f12a458ddb0f81/LICENSE-MIT) at your option.  Unless you explicitly state otherwise, any contribution intentionally submitted for inclusion in this crate by you, as defined in the Apache-2.0 license, shall be dual licensed as above, without any additional terms or conditions. 
#### Dependencies
~185–610KB  ~14K SLoC
  * [proc-macro2](https://lib.rs/crates/proc-macro2 "1.0.74")
  * [quote](https://lib.rs/crates/quote "1.0.35")
  * [syn](https://lib.rs/crates/syn "2.0.46")


  * dev  [rustversion](https://lib.rs/crates/rustversion "1.0.13")
  * dev  [serde](https://lib.rs/crates/serde "1.0.166")
  * dev  [serde_json](https://lib.rs/crates/serde_json "1.0.100")
  * dev  [trybuild](https://lib.rs/crates/trybuild "1.0.81")[+diff](https://lib.rs/crates/trybuild/features#feature-diff)


  *[SLoC]: approx. additional lines of code

enriched_crate.readme_summary: The `serde_repr` crate enables serialization and deserialization of C-like enums in Rust by delegating to their underlying numeric representation (e.g., `#[repr(u8)]`). It provides two derive macros, `Serialize_repr` and `Deserialize_repr`, allowing seamless integration with formats like JSON while preserving the enum's numeric values. This is particularly useful for interoperability with external systems that use numeric representations for enums.
enriched_crate.factual_counterfactual:
### Pair 1: Enum Serialization and Deserialization  
✅ Factual: The `serde_repr` crate allows you to derive `Serialize` and `Deserialize` traits for C-like enums, delegating to their underlying representation (e.g., `#[repr(u8)]`).  
❌ Counterfactual: The `serde_repr` crate supports serialization and deserialization for all Rust enums, including those with associated data fields.  

---

### Pair 2: Supported Representations  
✅ Factual: The `serde_repr` crate works with enums that have explicit primitive representations, such as `#[repr(u8)]`, `#[repr(i32)]`, or other integer types.  
❌ Counterfactual: The `serde_repr` crate supports enums with floating-point representations, such as `#[repr(f32)]` or `#[repr(f64)]`.  

---

### Pair 3: Error Handling in Deserialization  
✅ Factual: When deserializing an invalid value that does not match any enum variant, `serde_repr` returns an error instead of defaulting to a specific variant.  
❌ Counterfactual: When deserializing an invalid value, `serde_repr` automatically maps it to the first variant of the enum as a fallback.
